div.pre: 187 Corinth environs, 1938 Burial: c. 215 B.C. (Noe) Contents: c. 400 AR.* Pot hoard Alexander III: 20 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 4, Pella 1, Miletus 1, Citium 1, Aradus 1, Ace 1, Babylon 10, Cyrene 1) 14 late post. tetradr. (Mace- donia 1, unc. Pelop. 10, Megalopolis 1, Argos 1, Clazomenae 1) 80 lifetime and early post. dr. (Asia Minor mints) Philip III: 1 tetradr. (Aradus) 9 dr. (Asia Minor mints) Antigonus Gonatas: 1 dr. Lysimachus: 6 lifetime dr. (Lampsacus 1, Colophon 2, Ephesus 2, unc. 1) Aetolian League: 7 tetradr. Athens: 136 tetradr.; 5 dr. (4 with symbols) Ephesus: 2 tetradr. Rhodes: 18 didr. Seleucus I: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim, unc. Syria) Antiochus I: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) Antiochus II: 2 tetradr. (Ephesus, Smyr- na?) Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) Seleucus III: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) Ptolemy I: 28 tetradr. Ptolemy II: 62 tetradr. (incl. issues of Sidon, Tyre, Gaza) Disposition: Athens c. 388 BCH 1938, p. 446 Noe, ANSMN 10 (1962), pp. 9-41, illus. * To the 382 coins recorded by Noe one must add some, or perhaps most, of the 38 coins described in the BCH 1960 (pp. 487-8) as coming from two sepa- rate lots found in or near Corinth. The two lots almost certainly belong to- gether and the link with the Corinth hd. of 1938 is provided by the Alex- ander of Clazomenae reproduced on Noe's pl. 3, 154 and on Varoucha's pl. 7, 6
